column4: heya, what would be the easiest way to execute a command every 10 minutes, I would like to have a little script that pipes the results from sensors into a txt-file every ten minutes, so that I can check later on how hot it got ...
yes that's what I thought ... sadly I don't understand the man-page, which is why I'm here ... how do you tell cron to do something? :s
theres 1000+s of cron example/tutorial sites out there.
rember to give it FULL paths to scripts/commands - 'just in case' :) thats been an issue ive frogotten in the past.
they are allready current/up to date.. so not redownloaded
you could always do a new install to a flash drive and test it out and decide for yourself
my flash drive is too small and my cd drive broken, so I thought I'd ask and hope that if there are "big" known issues the community would be so honest to admit them upfront :p
may as well go for it then.
ive had to use 'winrar.exe' befor and wine. to extract some odd archives.. in the past. :) its a nasty way - but it worked.
do you know if there is a portable version of winrar? or do I need to install the full version
i just get the thing from the winrar homepage. used it to extract the archives i neede then deleted the wine isntall of it.
theres other arvhiver tools out.. but no idwa what ones use   "need PK compat. v6.3 (can do v4.6)"
could try the latest winzip i guess..  but 'outlook looks bad'
